message: The lamson daemon itself is not a WSGI app (and obviously not meant to be), so I was wondering, if it's possible to run a not-web-related (as in "not meant for web in the first place") project on ep.io
Not yet; we have support for non-WSGI apps in the pipeline, but we'll have to charge for the IPs you host them on (we can't loadbalance loads of apps off of one server for most protocols)

@nureineide It might not be the answer you are looking for, but, I am using http://mailgun.net/ to POST new emails into my web app. It has rudimentary matching to route mails to different urls, and then you can potentially build your subsequent behaviour in Django (this is the approach I am currently taking to handle building a web based / email app). They have a free tier (200 msg/day) and their receiving API is documented here - http://documentation.mailgun.net/Documentation/DetailedDocsAndAPIReference#Receiving_Messages
@bradwhittington Thanks, I've heard of mailgun before but didn't make the connection to Lamson in my head. So that is actually a way to solve my problem. Thanks again
